item.title: Rotting bags of rubbish on Badgemore Path, 12th August
item.description:
This rubbish has been here for 5 days now. Foodstuff rotting in 30 degrees heat. The smell is terrible. Letters with name and address of person who has dumped this are on the pile.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgemore Path, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 fridges and dishwasher blocking pavement, 12th August
item.description:
Our wonderful (DISGUSTING) new neighbours have decided to repay our generous welcome by dumping yet more of their stinking garbage on the street where our children play and wheelchairs cannot travel past YOU ARE CRIMINALS!! YOU ARE DISGUSTING !!!! DO YOU HAVE NO SHAME AT ALL? THIS IS NOT A RUBBISH DUMP YOU HORRIBLE SELFISH PEOPLE !!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Copleston Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown weeds in council flats, 12th August

item.title: Please ask the cleaning team on Kelly Avenue to disinfect the communal bins on the corner of Watts Street ASAP bins, 12th August
item.description:
On the corner of Watts Street and Kelly Avenue there is a rubbish bin room which is absolutely unacceptably filthy and extremely smelly which is very toxic to our area and needs to be cleaned and disinfected immediately. We cannot open our windows which are just right next to this filthy and disgusting smelling rubbish room full of dirty 100 flies. Please urgently provide disinfecting clean with bleach or any other disinfectant of the rubbish room and the 3 giant metal bins for health and safety of the residents who live right next to this rubbish room.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29; 31, Kelly Avenue, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paint dumpted in Public Manhole everyday, 12th August
item.description:
Location: • Osborne Mansions, Luxborough Street, London W1U 5BT Issue: • Daily dumping of excess white paint into public manhole outside Osborne Mansions. • Carried out by builders (sub-contractors) working for Notting Hill Genesis Housing Association. • Manhole cover now visibly covered in paint. • Likely contamination of public drainage system. Impact: • Possible breach of Environmental Protection Act 1990 and Water Resources Act 1991. • Damages the appearance and environmental quality of this residential street. Request: • Urgent inspection of site. • Immediate instruction to stop disposal into manhole. • Enforcement action to prevent recurrence. Confidentiality: • Reporting anonymously. • Absolute confidentiality requested — my identity must not be disclosed under any circumstances.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chiltern Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Job no 8004958, 12th August
